title: England women to go from sellout 90,000 capacity Wembley crowd... to just 6,681 people three days later
text:
The England women’s team will go from a sellout crowd at a 90,000 capacity Wembley Stadium to a ground in the Czech Republic that holds just 6,681 people in the space of three days.

The Lionesses announced they will play the Czech Republic at Stadion Strelecky ostrov in a friendly on November 12, having taken on Germany at Wembley three days earlier.

Stadion Strelecky ostrov is located more than 90 miles south of Prague, meaning fans will need to fly to Prague and take a two-hour drive to reach the ground, which is the home of SK Dynamo, currently 12th in the men’s Czech First League.

The Czech Republic are currently 28th in the Fifa world rankings, while England are fifth. The majority of the Czech team play for local sides, with the exception of 19-year-old Andrea Staskova who this season moved to a Juventus team that won a cup and league double in Italy last year.

England trio Jordan Nobbs, Beth Mead and Leah Williamson will face five players in the Czech Republic team next week when Arsenal take on Slavia Prague in the second leg of their Champions League last-16 tie, after Arsenal won the first leg 5-2.
description: The England women’s team will go from a sellout crowd at a 90,000 capacity Wembley Stadium to a ground in the Czech Republic that holds just 6,681 people in the space of three days.
